result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey M. Schulz #174415 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Jeffrey M. Schulz #174415 was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffrey M. Schulz #174415 is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Jeffrey M. Schulz #174415 was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes:
Court orders: eligible for Parole after 2 years.
Conditions of Parole:
DNA Sample and Surcharge.
Comply with sex offender evaluation and treatment. 
No contact with any minor without prior approval of agent. 
No contact with ERM and AJM or their families.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations. 
Complete specific programming as determined by the Department. 
Comply with sex offender registration.

4:04  Defendant Jeffrey M. Schulz in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Defendant Jeffrey M. Schulz in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PO Agent Travis Gaetz and Lana Sullivan are present by phone. Conditions of Extended Supervision were not given at the sentencing.  The Court will address them at this time. Froelich states this is a parole case not extended supervision. Davis does not feel that sex offender registration applies.  The conditions of extended supervision and or parole are:  Comply with sex offend evaluation and treatment   No contact with any minor without prior approval of agent.  No contact with ERM and AJM or their families.   Provide a DNA sample and surcharge . Pay all court ordered financial obligations .  Complete specific progarming as determined by the department.      Comply with the sex offender registration.
Partial. Sentencing hearing held on October 19, 2015 with Judge Boles presiding. Filed by RMR T Carlson
Hearing at 11-04-2015 04:00 pm.

1:55  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by phone means for Defendant Jeffrey M. Schulz. Prosecuting Atty Sean Edward Froelich appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jeffrey M. Schulz not in court.  Court is reviewing the sentence that was given yesterday in regards to whether extended supervision is to be imposed on this sentence. Davis does not object to the no contact. Sex registration Davis requests that this not be imposed. Judge wants to have another hearing before the defendant is transfered to the prison system. Hearing to be set up for next week.
letters submitted on behalf of the Defendant at the time of sentencing.

2:35 Defendant Jeffrey M. Schulz in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich has no changes to PSI. Davis: State's PSI:  versions and facts differ. Pg 16: part of the compass evaluation. Court: takes consideration of recommendations. Froelich gives sentencing argument. no contact with any minors or victims (EM): register of as a sex offender. 8- 10 years. DNA sample and surcharge. Report to custody today. Requests 2 weeks to determine restitution. Victim (EM) addresses courtroom. Atty Davis gives sentencing argument; imposed and stayed sentence with probation and some jail time. 3 letters are given to the Court on behalf of the defendant. Pastor Hawell addresses the courtroom. Mike Skalzy addresses the courtroom. Jerilyn Schulz addresses the courtroom. Mrs. Schulz addresses the courtroom. Defendant addresses the courtroom. Court: goes over sentencing factors: gravity of offense, character of defendant, need to protect the public, rehabilitative needs of defendant, appropriate answer for the act(s) committed  and recommendations of PSI. Court orders: 6 total year confinement. eligible  for parole after 2 years. remanded into custody today.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

9:29  In West Courtroom.  23 Jurors are seated. Defendant Jeffrey M. Schulz in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge Boles calls the case and does the voir dire of the panel. Atty Froelich voir dires the panel. Atty Davis voir dires the panel. 10:27  Break    10:39  Court resumes. Voir dire of the jurors continues. Attorneys make 5 strikes each. 13 jurors are selected. Jury panel sworn. 10:58 Jury is excused  /attys and defendat are present. Judge makes ruling on the sequestration  - Court officer will be in court. 1st witness will testify and the 2nd witness will not be in courtroom. After they are finished testifying they may come into the courtroom and remain for the trial.  Rape/Shield law  - JUdge rules that the testimony will not be permitted unless 971.31 allows it. 11:05  Break until 11:20.  11:24  Attorneys and defendant are present. Judge addresses the use of names instead of initials in the verdict and instructions. 11:28  Jury returns to the courtroom. Judge gives the preliminary instructions to the jury. 11:40  Atty Sean Froelich gives his opening statement.  E W is sw and exam by Froelich. 12:10 Break for lunch.12:15
1:15   Court resumes. Attorneys, Defendant and Jury are in the courtroom.  X examination of E W by Nich Davis. 1:43 Jury is excused  Jury J V. is present with attorneys and defendant.  Juror has recognized the names of 2 people named in   E W  testimony, Attorneys do not object to keeping him on. He will remain on the jury.  1:49  Attorneys, defendant and the witness are in the courtroom and Judge reads the definition of sexual intercourse. 1:51  The jury returns to the courtroom. X-exam of E W continues. Froelich re-directs. Questions from jury are reviewed by Judge and the defendants. Judge answers one of the questions from Juror SA.  AW is sw and exam by Froelich. Witness ID's the defendant.  ATty Davis x-exams. S Froelich  re-directs    3:19 Recess   3:44 Court resumes. Jury Question is submitted and read to witness AW.  Investigator Charles Golden is sw and exam by Froelich. Exh # 1 Copy of disk of interview with Jeffrey Schulz. Offered and received. Jury is excused. 4:00  Jury returns and exam of Invetigator Golden continues. . Question from jury is reviewed by attorneys and Judge. Judege asks the question of Invetigator Golden.   State Rests.  Judge insrtucts the jury regarding no discussion of case.  Jury is excused until 8:30 tomorrow .4:11  Attys and defendant are in the courtroom.  Judge has handed out proposed jury instructions and verduct,  Davis makes a motion to dismiss criminal complaint. Court will take that motion up tomorrow morning. 4:15
8:31  Wed. June 17, 2015   Court resumes - Attys and defendant are present in the courtroom.  Atty Davis agrues his motion to dismiss. Atty Froelich responds. Requests  to Amend information for date of occurance to May 1 - June 30 for both informations  Court finds enough evidence to establish a place - Bartosh Lane house. Charge where E W is the victim the motion is denied.  Motion in regard to A W is denied as well. Motion to amend information is granted. There will be 2 counts instead of 3.  Atty Davis states his client will testify. Court reviews the defendants right to remain silent.   8:51  Jury is present in the courtroom.  The Judge explains to th jury about the amended information and what it means.  Atty Davis gives his opening statement. Jeffrey Schulz is sw and exam by Atty Davis. Froelich x-exams.  Juror question is reviewed by attorneys and Judge. Judge asks the witness the question. Another Juror question which is reviewed by the Judge and attorneys. The Judge asks the question of the defendant.  9:43  Break for 10 minutes
10:00  Jamie Schutz is sw and ex by Atty Davis. Froelich x-exams  Jurors have question Attys and Judge review  Judge reads questions to the witness. Jerilyn Schulz is sw and ex by Atty Davis  Froelich x-exams. Defense Rests  10:58  Break for 10 minutes. 11:15  Court resumes Attys and defendant are present. The state files an amended information with the court. The State will not be calling rebuttal witnesses.  Verdict and instruction conference.  Verdict OK  Instructions are reviewed. 11:27  Break for changes to be made. 11:51  Court resumes Attorneys, defendant and jury are present. Judge instructs the jury. A copy of the jury instructions are given to each juror. Froelich gives his closing arguement. Atty DAvis gives closing arguement.  Froelich makes his final statement. Judge give the final insturctions to the jury. Juror Jill Schneider was drawn as the alternate and is released from jury  panel. Bailiffs are sworn. Jury is excused to deliberate. 1:26  Jury has a question. Jury requests a transcript. Judge states that it is not possible and explains to the jury how long it takes the court reporter to prepare the transcript.  1:29  Jury is sent back to deliberate.  Recess.           2:10  Jury has a question Attorneys are present & defendant present. Judge reads the question they wish to hear the interview tape. Judge sends note back to jury. Jury replies to the questions from Judge2:26  Jury returns to courtroom to listen to the CD.   
3:47  Jury returns with a verdict.  Attorneys, defendant and jury present in courtroom. 
Not guilty of 2nd degree assualt of child  Ct 1
Guilty of 2nd degree assualt of child Ct 2
Judge polls the jury. 
Jury is excused. 3:50 PM
Judge dismisses Ct 1 and enters judgment of conviction of Ct 2 of amended information.  Attorneys agree. Sentencing date to be set. Davis requests a PSI  Court orders a PSI    Froelich requests bond be revoked. Davis disagrees. Requests bond to remain as is. Court orders bond is to continue as is with the conditions as previously ordered

8:42  In East Courtroom.  Defendant Jeffrey M. Schulz in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge reviews the procedures for jury trials with the attorneys. Witness lists are reviewed and timing is discussed. Seat 23 each will have 5 strikes. 1 alternate. Witnesses to be sequestored Court officer Golden will be in courtroom and victims(Judge will review to see if the rule applies).  Froelich addresses the recording that he intends to play and the portions that will not be played. Davis objects to part of it. Court rules that it may be played. Atty Davis addresses several things that were not disclosed in discovery. State will not be bringing this information in. Court recesses.4:00 Jury is excused. Atty Davis objects to testimony about a letter. Froelich responds. 4:04 Jurors return. Atty Froelich resumes ex of Investigator Golden.
AMENDED
